Detailed Description

Simple Collider that only culls Collidable pairs that have been disabled (also flattens a heirarchy of Collidable/CollidableGroups into a flat set of CollidableBodys) i.e. listeners will only be called with CollidableBodys, no CollidableGroups will be passed through - instead all combinations of pairs of CollidableBodys from any group will be passed. This is useful to pass to a CollisionDetector, which only accepts CollidableBodys.

Definition at line 48 of file SimpleCollisionCuller.

virtual void physics::SimpleCollisionCuller::collide (  ref< const Collidable >  collidable  )  [inline, virtual]
 

convenience method that calls collide(collidable1, collidable2) for each pair of Collidables in the group collidable, unless collidable isn't a group or has child inter-collision disabled (so that you can keep all your Collidables in a single top-level group)

Reimplemented from physics::Collider.

bool base::Referenced::unreference (   )  const [inline, inherited]
 

Decrement the reference count by one, indicating that a pointer to this object is referencing it. If the refence count goes to zero, it is assumed that this object is nolonger referenced and is automatically deleted.
